medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric and right upper quadrant abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was in his usual state of health until dinner 4 days ago, when he developed epigastric pain approximately 2 hours after the meal. The following day, the pain radiated to the right upper quadrant and around to the back. The pain is described as constant with a sharp component upon movement, exacerbated by eating, leading to reduced food intake. The patient has not had a bowel movement in 5 days, but does not feel distended.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of HCV, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (last HgA1c 13), Anxiety, history of intravenous drug use.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with diabetes, gallstones, Alzheimer's, died last year. Multiple family members with diabetes.
medical_history.social_history: Denies alcohol use or recent travel.
